data.title: Lynnette E. Foucher Cookbook Collection Finding Aid : Special Collections and University Archives, University of Massachusetts Amherst Libraries
data.text:
Scope of collection

Collector Lynnette E. Foucher assembled this cookbook collection and organized it into twenty-two distinct groups based on ingredient (exs. chocolate, yeast), company (ex. Pillsbury), and region (exs. local, international). While the bulk of the collection represents the period of the 1920s-1970s, it contains items from as early as 1902 and as late as 2000. Its strength lies in its documentation of corporations marketing their products to consumers, in particular to the American housewife.

From Lever Brothers Company's 10 Cakes Husbands Like Best (1952) to General Electric's Meals Go Modern Electrically (1940) cookbooks offered companies a unique opportunity to enter a woman's home where they continued to influence what she prepared and how she prepared it long after she left the market. These corporate cookbooks often promised women something greater than a delicious cake; they promised to provide them more free time to spend with their families, ways to economize, and a more glamorus lifestyle. As a result this collection is a rich source for the study of modern household technology, cooking and food trends, women's history, and consumerism during the 20th century

Series descriptions

13 items

Cookbooks produced by shortening and cooking oil companies promoting their products.

Cookbooks featuring baking powder or soda promoting Rumford, Davis, Arm and Hammer, and Calmut.

8 items

Cookbooks focused chiefly on baking bread as well as other recipes that call for yeast.

20 items

Cookbooks for baked goods produced by flour companies, such as General Foods, General Mills, and Reliable Flour Company.

22 items

Cookbooks produced by Pillsbury to celebrate award winning recipes in a variety of recipe contests.

Cookbooks that feature recipes requiring sweetners including molasses, Karo syrup, and sugar.

Cookbooks produced by spice or condiment companies highlighting their products; includes Lea and Perrins Worcestershire sauce, Gulden's mustard, and French's mustard.

Cookbooks featuring recipes requiring evaporated or condensed milk, chiefly Carnation and Borden companies, and tapioca.

8 items

Cookbooks produced by Knox Gelatine, Inc.

Cookbooks featuring nuts and fruit products, such as Sunkist lemons, Ocean Spray cranberries, and Sun-maid raisins.

7 items

Cookbooks focused on chocolate recipes, chiefly Baker's chocolate.

9 items

Cookbooks featuring meat recipes issued by the American Meat Institute and the National Live Stock and Meat Board.

Cookbooks produced by pasta and rice companies highlighting their products; includes recipes from Mueller, Campbell's, and Prince.

Cookbooks featuring a variety of vegetables from zucchini to potatoes.

26 items

Cookbooks produced by general food companies such as Kraft, Heinz, and Kellogg.

5 items

Books providing instructions on canning along with recipes.

Cookbooks featuring innovative kitchen appliances or cookware from the electric mixer to the blender.

Series of cookbooks produced by the Culinary Arts Institute often highlighting a specific ingredient or type of food from candy to leftovers.

21 items

Cookbooks featuring regional ingredients and recipes.

16 items

Cookbooks focused on international cuisine and recipes.

47 items
